answers.answer: Calm down Just Because U Failed The One Hour Test Doesn't Mean Anything. I failed the one hour but passed the 3hr

I'm just so nervous. Like ive been so sick during this entire pregnancy so far and I do all I can to take care of myself. I always pray for good health and a healthy baby but it seems like it just gets worse.

If you do end up having gestational diabetes try and look at it in a positive way. You change your diet to being way healthy and it may even help you feel better. I know with my first baby I had gestational diabetes and felt horrible until I found out I actually had GD and had to change my diet. I didnt feel sick anymore and had more energy. Remember to look for the silver lining. Because of the complications I had with my 1st son, this time around I feel like I can take on anything. You can do this!
I failed my one hour one and passed the 3 hour one lol My mom did the same thing. It's actually pretty common to fail one but not the other :) Good luck!

Its going to be OK so did I. I had a 33 and my doctor preferred a 31. It was the hardest test ever I was so weak and hungry afterwards but I passed. Just bring stuff to entertain yourself and u will be just fine.

Thank you ladies. I've said a good prayer and I'm really hoping that I pass. I've been through so much throughout this pregnancy. It's been very hard on my health. I only have 3 months left and I'm praying that I won't have to spend them pricking my finger everyday.
I passed my 3hr test ladies! Thanks so much for the support and words of encouragement.

question: I'm 28 weeks and I failed my 1hr glucose screening test. I have to go back tomorrow for the 3hr one and I'm so afraid that I may have gestational diabetes! I've been through so much with this pregnancy from Hyperemesis, to Hyperthyroidism, and now this! I'm seriously on the verge of being stressed out and depressed to the max... Is there a chance that I pass the 2nd screening? Advice please!?
title: Failed My Glucose Test!
